intro: Astragalus virgatus var. uralensis, commonly known as the Ural milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the steppes of Central Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. The plant produces yellow flowers in spikes, which bloom from June to August. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to dry, temperate climates. This variety is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its hardiness and ability to stabilize soil.
